snippet: A 1987 lawsuit against the N.C.A.A. underscores the difficulty of litigating claims of antitrust violations that the governor of Pennsylvania has recently made over Penn State’s sanctions.
abstract: Several lawsuits against NCAA are now being recalled after Gov Tom Corbett of Pennsylvania announced that he was suing organization on behalf of the state; he is alleging that NCAA committed antitrust violations through the penalties it levied on Penn State after the Jerry Sandusky child sexual abuse scandal; 1987 lawsuit by Southern Methodist University underscores difficulty of litigating claims of antitrust violations.
lead_paragraph: A 1987 lawsuit against the N.C.A.A. underscores the difficulty of litigating claims of antitrust violations that the governor of Pennsylvania has recently made over Penn State’s sanctions.

headline.seo: S.M.U. Case Suggests Hard Road for Corbett’s Penn State Suit
headline.main: Old Case Suggests Hard Road for a Governor’s Suit
headline.print_headline: Old Case Suggests a Hard Road for a Governor’s Suit Against the N.C.A.A.
